data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to the individual senses of words (synsets).

Contains nearly 5,000 text fragments, collected from financial news and press releases about Finnish companies listed on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic exchange. Each fragment is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.
A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, combining artificial intelligence and Semantic Web technologies to better recognize, interpret, and process opinions in this context.

Incorporates entity-sentiment annotation to address the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with potentially conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, with over 10,700 news headlines, provides information on sentiment variations depending on specific entities in financial news.

A tokenized and annotated dataset of speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts from the Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC). This resource seeks to understand the influence of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by central banks.

An annotated dataset of relationships within financial documents with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 types of relationships across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, organization-money), extracted from SEC 10-X forms. Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, it allows researchers to explore how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparisons, and other financial events.
A dataset designed for Named Entity Recognition (NER) in the financial environment, helping to identify and classify financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real financial article headlines in 15 languages. Annotated with high and low-level topics, facilitating multiclass and multilabel classification tasks.

A collection of question and answer pairs with a detailed analysis of financial reports. Written by financial experts, it focuses on deep reasoning about financial data, providing training data to answer complex financial queries.
